sentence: A jump in oil prices drove the main U.S. stock indexes higher late in the regular session, posting a second straight day of gains as investors overlooked the uncertainty around how the U.K.'s departure from the European Union will unfold.
U.S. crude neared $50 a barrel and Brent, the main international variety, nudged over that threshold after data showed that stockpiles in the US contracted by more than expected last week.
All 10 of the S&P 500 sectors rose near the closing bell, with energy and financials up about 2.2% each.
Nike ( NKE ) and financial stocks led advances among nearly all of the Dow Jones Industrial Average components, with only Home Depot ( HD ) fluctuating between gains and losses late in the day.
